page.title: 09LOWER HARDRES AREA-CHURCHES
page.content: The 14th century church of{St. {Mary's at Lower Hardres}was completely rebuilt in 1832. A clock adorns the flint walls and the spire makes a useful landmark. The church of{St. {Mary the Virgin at Nackington}was dedicated about 1076. It has flint walls with tower and steeple. In the nave traces of 11th century frescoes can be seen. There is some ancient glass depicting the martyrdom of St Thomas of Canterbury. Both churches are served by the Rector of Petham and Waltham. Congregations at weekly ser- vices average 15 at Christmas Mass the numbers rise to about 80.{St. Faith's} {New House Lane,}dedicated in 1954 is also the Community Hall. Part of the living of Thanington services are held fortnightly with congregations of about 20. The altar is curtained off when not used as a church.
